definition: to conduct oneself in an arrogant or superciliously pompous manner, to walk with an air of overbearing self-confidence
to force by argument or threat : bully
an arrogantly self-confident way of walking : an act or instance of swaggering

examples: "Taxi" opens with an argument over capital punishment between a progressive female teacher and a condescending loudmouth who's all macho swagger.
Thierry has the swagger of a man who blew off conventional wisdom and turned out just fine.

definition: marked by elegance or showiness : posh
